title: Quiz 3: Psychiatric Disorders & Management
topicName: KMTC Mental Health Notes  Comprehensive Notes
description: Comprehensive assessment on Schizophrenia, Mood Disorders, Anxiety, Personality Disorders, and specialized psychiatric conditions.

questions.question: Match the type of Schizophrenia with its defining characteristic:

pairs.right: Flat affect, poverty of speech, social withdrawal

questions.explanation: Catatonic involves motor symptoms. Paranoid involves suspicious delusions. Hebephrenic (Disorganized) involves silly/regressive behavior. Residual involves negative symptoms after acute phase.
questions.hint: Focus on the primary symptom: Motor vs. Thought Content vs. Behavior vs. After-effects.

questions.question: Which of the following are considered 'Positive Symptoms' of Schizophrenia? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Positive symptoms are excesses/distortions (Delusions, Hallucinations, Disorganized speech). Anhedonia and Avolition are Negative symptoms (deficits).
questions.hint: Positive means 'added' behaviors that shouldn't be there; Negative means 'missing' normal behaviors.

questions.question: Which Bipolar disorder classification is characterized by episodes of severe mania and severe depression?
questions.explanation: Bipolar I involves severe mania. Bipolar II involves hypomania (less severe) and severe depression.
questions.hint: Think of 'I' as the primary or most severe form of mania.

questions.question: The medication ___BLANK___ is used as a deterrent to drinking alcohol because it causes a severe adverse reaction when alcohol is ingested.
questions.explanation: Disulfiram (Antabuse) inhibits aldehyde dehydrogenase, causing toxic acetaldehyde buildup if alcohol is consumed.
questions.hint: It starts with 'D' and is also known as Antabuse.

questions.question: A patient with 'la belle indifference' (lack of concern about a severe symptom like blindness) likely has:
questions.explanation: Conversion Disorder is characterized by neurological symptoms (blindness, paralysis) without organic cause, often accompanied by a surprising lack of anxiety about the symptom.
questions.hint: The symptom converts anxiety into a physical deficit.

questions.question: Order the levels of Mental Retardation (Intellectual Disability) from highest IQ to lowest IQ:
questions.explanation: IQ Ranges: Borderline (71-84), Mild (50-70), Moderate (35-50), Severe (20-35), Profound (<20).
questions.hint: Start with the category closest to normal intelligence.

questions.question: Match the Personality Disorder Cluster to its description:
questions.explanation: Cluster A = Weird (Odd). Cluster B = Wild (Dramatic). Cluster C = Worried (Anxious).

questions.question: Which of the following is the acronym used for causes of Delirium?
questions.explanation: I WATCH DEATH stands for Infections, Withdrawal, Acute metabolic, Trauma, CNS pathology, Hypoxia, Deficiencies, Endocrine, Acute vascular, Toxins, Heavy metals.
